channel.title: My first helm
channel.description:
[b]I wanted to post this for the contest but i want grounded and the contest is now over[/b]
[IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/helm1.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/helm2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/helm3.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/yflow.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/yinfo.jpg[/img]
If anyone wants it just pm me comment please

item.title: My first helm
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

mhmm, i agree; looks great, but is slightly over poly, take some of my work for example, i make sure it has a clean face structure, and looks fine at the same time, wicch i acheve with a handy little button called delete, so i delete all my unwanted faces and re draw them with usefull ones.

-EDIT-
dident realize this was a grave dig, now whoever dug it up, please lay your self in the hole and die, it would be much appreciated.

Read full topic

8/10!
rep++

Did you just say “smashing”?
[/quote]
cough cheering him up cough[/quote]
Lmao it’s not a bad model, but you could’ve taken out roughly some 100 faces so it looks cleaner.

item.title: My first helm
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:12, topic:337038”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=433447.msg3183729#msg3183729 date=1271542971]

What double wire thing?

And don’t use knife unless you know what you’re doing with it. I personally hate it since I’ve never been good with free-form wire frames, I prefer simple manipulation.

If you dont learn to properly use the knife tool, then you wont make it very far modeling anything besides swords and other simple models.
[/quote]Guess I should start learning then

It just makes a basic shape into what you want and prevents unneeded faces.[/quote]Yea, but I always tended to have a hard time with it. I can see its usefulness, but I’ve never needed it before. If I find an opportunity to use it, I suppose I will.

Read full topic

item.title: My first helm
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:11, topic:337038”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=433447.msg3183338#msg3183338 date=1271521877]

What double wire thing?

And don’t use knife unless you know what you’re doing with it. I personally hate it since I’ve never been good with free-form wire frames, I prefer simple manipulation.

If you dont learn to properly use the knife tool, then you wont make it very far modeling anything besides swords and other simple models.
[/quote]Guess I should start learning then :|[/quote]
It just makes a basic shape into what you want and prevents unneeded faces.

Read full topic

item.title: My first helm
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:6, topic:337038”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=433447.msg3182630#msg3182630 date=1271457067]
It was all good until I saw the wireframe. That has some issues. You, too, do that double wire thing like rip4d. Try using the knife tool.
[/quote]You mean triangles? Cuz that’s what makes it look messy.
I have to agree that it would still be messy if it wasn’t triangulated.[/quote]
No I mean even before triangulation, you shouldn’t see wires cross over eachother that much.

Read full topic

item.title: My first helm

item.description:

I have to agree that it would still be messy if it wasn’t triangulated.
